sentences.english: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 百姓等候撒迦利亚，诧异他许久在殿里。

sentences.english: And it certainly surprises some China-watchers.
sentences.chinese: 而这当然也使一些中国观察家非常诧异。

sentences.english: It surprises me that you did not bring Mrs. Terrell along for company.
sentences.chinese: 我好诧异，你怎么没有带特瑞女士来做舞伴呀。

sentences.english: 6And he was amazed at their lack of faith. Then Jesus went around teaching from village to village.
sentences.chinese: 他也诧异他们不信，就往周围乡村教训人去了。

sentences.english: I was surprised at her marriage to her tefeel sorer.
sentences.chinese: 听说她嫁给了她的师长教师，我感到很诧异。

sentences.english: Now, Lizzy, I think I have surprised you.
sentences.chinese: 喂丽萃，我已经叫你感到诧异了吧。

sentences.english: That news would once have elicited at least a slightly surprised response.
sentences.chinese: 这一消息将再次引起至少有些诧异的反应。

sentences.english: Like the machine broke, shen Qiang said her own will fix, this let qin day very surprised.
sentences.chinese: 像机摔坏了，沈蔷说她自已会修，这让秦天很诧异。

sentences.english: 21Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering why he stayed so long in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 百姓等候撒迦利亚，诧异他许久在殿里。

sentences.english: Can you imagine how much I was surprised to hear the news?
sentences.chinese: 您能设念我闻声阿谁音尘有多诧异吗？

sentences.english: Alhambra resident Jenny Hu felt surprised and disappointed when she first saw the Alhambra Arch.
sentences.chinese: 第一次看到阿罕布拉的凯旋门时，感到和诧异。
黑根对这一评语感到很诧异。

sentences.english: But perhaps the most surprising stat of all comes courtesy of the current day.
sentences.chinese: 然而，也许最令人诧异的进程是如今相互间的殷勤。

sentences.english: So I’m not that surprised to see transsexuals this time around.
sentences.chinese: 所以，这次看到伪娘我并不诧异。

sentences.english: Bizarrely, the answer seems to be no.
sentences.chinese: 令人诧异的是，答案似乎是否定的。

sentences.english: I was surprised to see her slumming it in a fast-food restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 看到她屈就自己在快餐店里吃饭真让我诧异。

definition: to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to not understand/to be puzzled by/indissoluble
